comments.author: post@remerie.com
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; nl; rv:1.8.0.3) Gecko/20060426 Firefox/1.5.0.3
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; nl; rv:1.8.0.3) Gecko/20060426 Firefox/1.5.0.3

A php file describing a svg file like "<?php echo 'svg definition goes here'; ?>" is not parsed as a SVG picture when embedded <embed src="svg.php"> (no content is showed). When tested with the Adobe plugin there's no problem.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create file svg.php "<?php echo 'svg definition goes here'; ?>"
2. Create exemple.html and embed <embed src="svg.php">
3. Parse

Actual Results:  
Blank page

Expected Results:  
Picture
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; nl; rv:1.8.0.3) Gecko/20060426 Firefox/1.5.0.3
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; nl; rv:1.8.0.3) Gecko/20060426 Firefox/1.5.0.3

A php file describing a svg file like "<?php echo 'svg definition goes here'; ?>" is not parsed as a SVG picture when embedded <embed src="svg.php"> (no content is showed). When tested with the Adobe plugin there's no problem.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create file svg.php "<?php echo 'svg definition goes here'; ?>"
2. Create exemple.html and embed <embed src="svg.php">
3. Parse

Actual Results:  
Blank page

Expected Results:  
Picture
comments.creator: post@remerie.com
mauve@mauveweb.co.uk
comments.raw_text:
Not a bug.

You need to explicitly set header('Content-Type: image/svg+xml') in the PHP and preferably also type="image/svg+xml" in the <embed> element.
comments.text:
Not a bug.

You need to explicitly set header('Content-Type: image/svg+xml') in the PHP and preferably also type="image/svg+xml" in the <embed> element.
comments.author: mauve@mauveweb.co.uk
karl.vegar.larsen@refleks.com
comments.text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> Not a bug.
> 
> You need to explicitly set header('Content-Type: image/svg+xml') in the PHP and
> preferably also type="image/svg+xml" in the <embed> element.
> 

Headers set in both script and server config. Fx will still not take embeded svg images that has been on the fly generated by php5. 
If one use the Adobe Svgviewer hack (Copy the files from C:\Program Files\Common Files\Adobe\SvgViewer\plugin to C:Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\plugin), all appears OK. 

Example: 
http://karl.refleks.com/fx/singlesvg.html

http://karl.refleks.com/fx/singlesvg.html
comments.creator: karl.vegar.larsen@refleks.com

comments.text: Sorry, my bad. Note to self and others having simiilar problems: Content-Type: image/svg-xml != Content-Type: image/svg+xml Got confused when the files from the Adobe pluging fixed the problem.

comments.text:
(In reply to comment #2)
> http://karl.refleks.com/fx/singlesvg.html
> 

WFM on current Firefox 2 nightly. Windows, no svg plugins.

Daniel is correct. This is probably not a bug, but the description has too little information in it to be sure. If you can provide a testcase, feel free to reopen.
